Action.name: partitionForTimer
Action.Description:
Return the partition which should be used when manually creating a timer for input events.
The <tt>schedule</tt> and <tt>scheduleNow</tt> actions should be preferred over manually creating timers.
Action.Summary: Return the partition which should be used when manually creating a timer for input events.

Returns.Description: The partition to use when creating a timer.

Parameter.name: device
Parameter.Description: The source device ID for which partition is required.

Action.name: schedule
Action.Description:
Schedule the input event to be processed at the specified time. If no time is specified then the input event is scheduled to be processed as soon as possible.
This creates a timer for the specified timestamp or the earliest possible time. When the timer is triggered, the <tt>$timerTriggered</tt> action of the block is called and the <tt>inputEvent</tt> is passed as the payload.
It also determines the correct partition for the input event based on the properties of the source device specified when declaring the input block.
Action.Summary: Schedule the input event to be processed at the specified time. If no time is specified then the input event is scheduled to be processed as soon as possible.

Returns.Description: The handle to the timer created.

Parameter.name: inputEvent
Parameter.Description: The input event. It should be of the same type as specified in the <tt>CumulocityInputParams</tt>.

Parameter.name: timestamp
Parameter.Description: The source timestamp of the event. Pass an empty value if the source timestamp is not to be used or not available.

Action.name: scheduleNow
Action.Description:
Schedule the input event to be processed as soon as possible.
This creates a timer for the earliest possible time. When the timer is triggered, the <tt>$timerTriggered</tt> action of the block is called and the <tt>inputEvent</tt> is passed as the payload.
It also determines the correct partition for the input event based on the properties of the source device specified when declaring the input block.
Action.Summary: Schedule the input event to be processed as soon as possible.

Returns.Description: The handle to the timer created.

Parameter.name: inputEvent
Parameter.Description: The input event. It should be of the same type as specified in the <tt>CumulocityInputParams</tt>.

Action.name: declare
Action.Description:
Declare the input stream being consumed by the block.
This is an asynchronous operation that performs an inventory lookup for the source device or device group. It will call the <tt>handlerCreated</tt> action after the lookup is done.
It will call <tt>BlockBase.consumesInput()</tt> after the lookup to declare that the block is an input block.
This must be called during the <tt>$validate</tt> action, not afterward. Either the promise returned by this action or another promised chained with it must be returned from the <tt>$validate</tt> action.
Action.Summary: Declare the input stream being consumed by the block.

Parameter.name: handlerCreated
Parameter.Description: The Callback action to save the input handler created.

Action.name: declareAsync

Declare the async input stream being consumed by the block.

This must be called during the <tt>$validate</tt> action, not afterward. Either the promise returned by this action or another promised chained with it must be returned from the <tt>$validate</tt> action.
Action.Summary: Declare the async input stream being consumed by the block.

Action.name: routeOutput
Action.Description:
Route the output event internally only.
Normally, blocks would call sendOutput, but if there is a need to send output separately, this will only route the outputEvent (and forward to other worker contexts as needed). This method will also 'tag' the outputEvent.
Action.Summary: Route the output event internally only.

Reference.Description: The output event if it is synchronous.

Parameter.Description: The output event to send.

Parameter.name: $activation
Parameter.Description: The current activation.

Action.name: sendOutput
Action.Description:
Send the output event to model by sending it to the specified channel.
If the output is synchronous then it is routed internally for consumption by other models. The output event is also tagged by putting the model name against the apama_analytics_modelName key in the params dictionary of the event. Any input block consuming the same event type must filter out any events that have the same key in the dictionary.
Action.Summary: Send the output event to model by sending it to the specified channel.

Reference.Description: The output event to the output channel.

Parameter.name: outputEvent
Parameter.Description: The output event to send.

Parameter.name: channel
Parameter.Description: The channel on which to send the output event.

Parameter.name: $activation
Parameter.Description: The current activation.

It will call <tt>BlockBase.producesOutput()</tt> after the lookup to declare that the block is an output block.
This must be called during the <tt>$validate</tt> action, not afterward. Either the promise returned by this action or another promised chained with it must be returned from the <tt>$validate</tt> action.

Parameter.Description: The Callback action to save the output handler created.

Action.name: forAsyncEventType
Action.Description:
Create a new <tt>CumulocityOutputParams</tt> for asynchronous output events.
Asynchronous output events are events that do not have source timestamps and can only be consumed by another model in a time-asynchronous manner when they are received back. Examples of asynchronous output events are <tt>Operation</tt> and <tt>ManagedObject</tt>.
Action.Summary: Create a new <tt>CumulocityOutputParams</tt> for asynchronous output events.

Returns.Description: A new <tt>CumulocityOutputParams</tt>.

Parameter.name: deviceId
Parameter.Description: The target device identifier or the Trigger Device.

Parameter.name: block
Parameter.Description: The block object.

Parameter.name: eventTypeName
Parameter.Description: The fully qualified name of the event produced.

Action.name: forSyncEventType
Action.Description:
Create a new <tt>CumulocityOutputParams</tt> for synchronous output events.
Synchronous output events are events that have source timestamps and can be consumed by another model in a time-synchronous manner and can be processed by the model with any other data from the same timestamp. Examples of synchronous output events are <tt>Event</tt> and <tt>Measurement</tt>.
Synchronous output events are routed internally for consumption by any consumer model before being sent. These output events might be received back at some point in the future. In such cases, the value will already have been processed and so must be ignored. This is achieved by adding a tag to the output event when it is sent. Input blocks should check for the presence of such a tag and ignore an input event if the tag is present. Output events are tagged automatically if <tt>CumulocityOutputHandler</tt> is used for sending output events.
Action.Summary: Create a new <tt>CumulocityOutputParams</tt> for synchronous output events.

Returns.Description: A new <tt>CumulocityOutputParams</tt>.

Parameter.name: deviceId
Parameter.Description: The target device identifier or the Trigger Device.

Parameter.name: block
Parameter.Description: The block object.

Parameter.name: eventTypeName
Parameter.Description: The fully qualified name of the event that block produces. The events sent by the block should be of this type only.

Parameter.name: fields
Parameter.Description: The field values that the block sends.

Action.name: tagger
Action.Description: A tagger action.
Action.Summary: A tagger action.

Action.Summary: Validate the source value and extract the device ID to use from it.

Member.name: TIMEDELAY_SECS
Member.Description:
The maximum delay in seconds before Input blocks consider an event to be old.
Input blocks re-order input events, which is achieved by not processing them until TIMEDELAY_SECS after the timestamp in the object, thus delaying processing by this amount. If the event is delayed in its delivery to the correlator, such that the delay is greater than or equal to this value, then the input is considered old and will be dropped and not processed.
Member.Summary: The maximum delay in seconds before Input blocks consider an event to be old.

Member.name: LOGGING_THROTTLE_SECS
Member.Description:
Logging throttling in seconds.
Interval used for periodic logging, such as reporting changes in the number of dropped events by Input blocks (for events delayed by more than TIMEDELAY_SECS). Log statements will not appear more frequently than this period.
Member.Summary: Logging throttling in seconds.

Member.name: MINIMUM_WAIT_TIME_SECS
Member.Description:
Minimum wait time in seconds.
Some blocks can generate output automatically, based on the rate of change of the output. This sets a lower limit on the time between outputs, in seconds.
Member.Summary: Minimum wait time in seconds.

Action.name: schedule
Action.Description:
Schedule the input event to be processed at the specified time. If no time is specified then the input event is scheduled to be processed as soon as possible.
This creates a timer for the specified timestamp or the earliest possible time. When the timer is triggered, the <tt>$timerTriggered</tt> action of the block is called and the <tt>inputEvent</tt> is passed as the payload.
Action.Summary: Schedule the input event to be processed at the specified time. If no time is specified then the input event is scheduled to be processed as soon as possible.

Returns.Description: The handle to the timer created.

Parameter.name: inputEvent
Parameter.Description: The input event.

Parameter.name: timestamp
Parameter.Description: The source timestamp of the event. Pass empty value if the source timestamp is not to be used or not available.

Parameter.name: partition
Parameter.Description: The partition to which the input value belongs, if it is partitioned. Pass an empty value if the input is not partitioned.

Action.name: scheduleNow
Action.Description:
Schedule the input event to be processed as soon as possible.
This creates a timer for the earliest possible time. When the timer is triggered, the $timerTriggered action of the block is called and the value is passed as payload.
Action.Summary: Schedule the input event to be processed as soon as possible.

Returns.Description: The handle to the timer created.

Parameter.name: value
Parameter.Description: The input event.

Parameter.name: partition
Parameter.Description: The partition to which the input value belongs, if it is partitioned. Pass empty value if the input is not partitioned.

Action.name: forAsyncEventType
Action.Description:
Create a new <tt>OutputParams</tt> for asynchronous output values.
Asynchronous output values are value which do not have source timestamp and can only be consumed by another model in a time-asynchronous manner when they are received back from the external system.
Action.Summary: Create a new <tt>OutputParams</tt> for asynchronous output values.

Returns.Description: A new <tt>OutputParams</tt>.

Parameter.name: eventType
Parameter.Description: The fully-qualified type name of the output event block produces.

Action.name: forSyncEventType
Action.Description:
Create a new <tt>OutputParams</tt> for synchronous output values.
Synchronous output values are values which have source timestamp and can be consumed by another model in a time-synchronous manner and can be processed by the model with any other data from the same timestamp.
The synchronous output values are routed internally for the consumption of any consumer model before sending it outside. The output value may be received back in future. The value was already processed and must be ignored. This is achieved by adding a tag to the output event which is sent outside. The input blocks check for the presence of such tag and ignore an input event if the tag is present.
Action.Summary: Create a new <tt>OutputParams</tt> for synchronous output values.

Returns.Description: A new <tt>OutputParams</tt>.

Parameter.name: eventType
Parameter.Description: The fully-qualified type name of the output event block produces.

Parameter.name: fields
Parameter.Description: The field values that the block sends.

Parameter.name: tagger
Parameter.Description: The action to tag the output event before it is sent outside so that it is ignore by input blocks if received back in future. The action must take exactly one parameter of same type as <tt>eventType</tt> and must not return anything, for example, <tt>action tagOutput(MyEvent evt) {} </tt>.

Type.name: Promise
Type.Description:
An asynchronous promise result.
A <tt>Promise</tt> represents something that may be fulfilled (with an <tt>any</tt> value) or rejected (with an <tt>Exception</tt>) later. <tt>Promise</tt> objects can be chained, to make linear asynchronous chains of calls. The 'then' methods (<tt>andThen</tt>, <tt>thenOrCatch</tt>) take an action which returns an <tt>any</tt> - if that <tt>any</tt> is a <tt>Promise</tt>, then it is waited on until any 'then' actions are called.
A <tt>Promise</tt> is created with the static <tt>create</tt> action, which takes an <tt>fn</tt> action to call. The fulfill and reject actions are passed to this function (this pattern ensures that exceptions thrown by the <tt>fn</tt> action are caught and the <tt>Promise</tt> is rejected).
Type.Summary: An asynchronous promise result.

Member.name: returnValue
Member.Description: The return value, if there is one.
Member.Summary: The return value, if there is one.

Member.name: settled
Member.Description: Promise is fulfilled or has been rejected. One of the SETTLED_ constants
Member.Summary: Promise is fulfilled or has been rejected. One of the SETTLED_ constants

Member.name: SETTLED_NONE
Member.Description: Not settled yet.
Member.Summary: Not settled yet.

Member.name: SETTLED_PROMISE
Member.Description: Settled, but with a promise.
Member.Summary: Settled, but with a promise.

Member.name: SETTLED_VALUE
Member.Description: Settled, with a value (or an exception).
Member.Summary: Settled, with a value (or an exception).

Member.name: exception
Member.Description: The exception if failed.
Member.Summary: The exception if failed.

Member.name: chain
Member.Description: The callbakcs registered against this promise.
Member.Summary: The callbakcs registered against this promise.

Action.name: _deferIfPromise
Action.Description:
Set return value or defer if it is a promise.
If value is another Promise, we chain ourselves to that promise - i.e. we are done when it is.
This must not be called directly by users (it leaves the promise in a partly resolved state).
Action.Summary: Set return value or defer if it is a promise.

Returns.Description: true if we deferred (end of synchronous processing), false if the return value is set and we can continue synchronously.

Action.name: _doCatch
Action.Description:
Previous promise is rejected.
Calls our 'boundCatch' if set, and the resolves the next promise. Rejects next promise if boundCatch throws or if boundCatch is empty.
Action.Summary: Previous promise is rejected.

Action.name: _doThen
Action.Description:
Previous promise is fulfilled.
Calls our 'boundThen' if set, and then resolves the next promise. Rejects next promise on an exception.
Action.Summary: Previous promise is fulfilled.

Action.name: _fulfill
Action.Description:
Fulfills this promise.
If value is another Promise, we chain ourselves to that promise - i.e. we are done when it is.
This must not be called directly by users (we don't trust them to call it only once).
Action.Summary: Fulfills this promise.

Action.name: _fulfill_return
Action.Description:
Fulfill the promise from another promise.
Convenience variant that returns new any. Used only in deferIfPromise to convert a promise to a newer value (may be another promise or value)
Action.Summary: Fulfill the promise from another promise.

Action.name: _nowSettled
Action.Description:
This promise is now settled.
Called from reject/ fulfill (once it has a non-promise value).
This attempts to call chained promises.
The common case, a single chained promise, is handled iteratively, to avoid stack overflow. Once we get to an asynchronous result (a Promise) this returns. If we come across Promise with something other than one chained promise (including none- the end of the promise chain), then we switch to recursive; we expect this to be rare.
Action.Summary: This promise is now settled.

Action.name: _reject
Action.Description:
Reject this promise.
Only
Action.Summary: Reject this promise.

Action.name: _reject_return
Action.Description:
Reject the promise.
Convenience variant that returns new any.
Action.Summary: Reject the promise.

Action.name: _throwIfSettled
Action.Description: Throw an exception if the promise is already settled.
Action.Summary: Throw an exception if the promise is already settled.

Action.name: andCatch
Action.Description:
Catch an asynchronous exception.
Executes the callback if this <tt>Promise</tt> is rejected.
Action.Summary: Catch an asynchronous exception.

Returns.Description: A <tt>Promise</tt> of the result of the callback method (or this <tt>Promise</tt> value if it is not rejected).

Parameter.name: cb
Parameter.Description: Called if the <tt>Promise</tt> is rejected.

Action.name: andThen
Action.Description:
Execute a function after this <tt>Promise</tt> is completed.
Executes the callback once this <tt>Promise</tt> is fulfilled with a real (non-<tt>Promise</tt>) value. Returns a <tt>Promise</tt> of the result of the callback (or the result of the result of the callback if it is a <tt>Promise</tt>).
Action.Summary: Execute a function after this <tt>Promise</tt> is completed.

Returns.Description: A <tt>Promise</tt> of the result of the callback method (or rejected on exception).

Parameter.name: cb
Parameter.Description: Callback called when the <tt>Promise</tt> is fulfilled.

Action.name: create
Action.Description:
Create a promise based on an action which accepts callback arguments (done, fail).
The function is called immediately, but it may call the <tt>any</tt> or <tt>Exception</tt> function at any point in the future. Only the first call is used. Calling the first function with a <tt>Promise</tt> will wait for that to be fulfilled before fulfilling this promise.
Action.Summary: Create a promise based on an action which accepts callback arguments (done, fail).

Parameter.name: func
Parameter.Description: Function to compute the promise value, setting the value by calling one of the two function parameters.

Action.name: fail
Action.Description:
Fail the promise.
If the promise is already settled, an exception is thrown because a promise cannot be settled more than once.
Action.Summary: Fail the promise.

Action.name: fulfill
Action.Description:
Fulfill the promise.
If the value is another Promise, we chain ourselves to that promise, i.e. we are done when the other promise is done.
If the promise is already settled, an exception is thrown because a promise cannot be settled more than once.
Action.Summary: Fulfill the promise.

Action.name: reject
Action.Description: Convert an <tt>Exception</tt> into a rejected <tt>Promise</tt>.
Action.Summary: Convert an <tt>Exception</tt> into a rejected <tt>Promise</tt>.

Parameter.name: e
Parameter.Description: An <tt>Exception</tt> describing the failure.

Action.name: resolve
Action.Description:
Convert a <tt>Promise</tt> or a value which is not a <tt>Promise</tt> into a <tt>Promise</tt>.
Can be used to convert synchronous bare values into asynchronous <tt>Promise</tt> objects.
Action.Summary: Convert a <tt>Promise</tt> or a value which is not a <tt>Promise</tt> into a <tt>Promise</tt>.

Parameter.name: value
Parameter.Description: The <tt>Promise</tt> to resolve the <tt>Promise</tt> to, or if it is a <tt>Promise</tt>, to get the result from.

Action.name: thenOrCatch
Action.Description:
Execute a function after this promise is completed.
Executes onThen or onCatch once this promise is fulfilled or rejected Returns a Promise of the result of onThen or onCatch (or a rejected promise if an uncaught exception occurs).
Action.Summary: Execute a function after this promise is completed.

Returns.Description: a Promise of the result of the cb method (or rejected on exception)

Parameter.name: onThen
Parameter.Description: optional action to call when this promise is fulfilled with a concrete value.

Parameter.name: onCatch
Parameter.Description: optional action to call when this promise is rejected.

Type.name: PromiseChainEntry
Type.Description:
A registered callback for a promise.
Each promise stores the promises that follow it and have been returned by andThen or andCatch.
Type.Summary: A registered callback for a promise.

Member.name: promise

Member.Summary: Next promise (must be any because we can't do forward types..)

Member.name: boundThen

andThen callback.

Member.Summary: andThen callback.

Member.name: boundCatch
Member.Description:
andCatch callback.

Member.Summary: andCatch callback.

Type.name: PromiseReturner
Type.Description:
Helper class for handling promises. A promiseReturner ignores the promise's previous value and returns (or throws) a new value. Usage: 
 promise.andThen(PromiseReturner.create(object).andReturn)
This will wait for promise to complete, then ignore it's return value and return object.
Type.Summary: Helper class for handling promises.

Member.Description: The bound object to return.
Member.Summary: The bound object to return.

Promise-compatible action chain that will return the obj this PromiseReturner was created with.
The incoming value is discarded.
Action.Summary: Promise-compatible action chain that will return the obj this PromiseReturner was created with.

Type.name: TypeConverter
Type.Description:
Type converter helper event for consistently converting from one type to another.
The toType() actions obey the conversions in the Analytics Builder documentation. The valueToType() actions delve deeper and attempt to convert the contents of a string or any.
Type.Summary: Type converter helper event for consistently converting from one type to another.

Action.Summary: Common string to float conversion. Throws if unable to convert.

Action.name: _tidy
Action.Description: Common tidy function for a string, prior to type conversion.
Action.Summary: Common tidy function for a string, prior to type conversion.

Action.Summary: Converts a string into the type and returns the result within an any.

Action.name: toBoolean
Action.Description: Converts an any to a boolean. As per the Analytics Builder documentation, any non-empty or non-zero value results in a true result.
Action.Summary: Converts an any to a boolean. As per the Analytics Builder documentation, any non-empty or non-zero value results in a true result.

Action.name: toFloat
Action.Description: Converts an any to a float. As per the Analytics Builder documentation, a string type cannot be cast to a float and an exception will be thrown.
Action.Summary: Converts an any to a float. As per the Analytics Builder documentation, a string type cannot be cast to a float and an exception will be thrown.

Action.name: toValue
Action.Description: Converts the any to a Value object. The any will be set as the value of the Value.
Action.Summary: Converts the any to a Value object. The any will be set as the value of the Value.

Action.name: valueToBoolean
Action.Description: Converts the value to a boolean. In this case, for a string, the contents of the string are parsed and converted rather than the string type itself.
Action.Summary: Converts the value to a boolean. In this case, for a string, the contents of the string are parsed and converted rather than the string type itself.

Action.name: valueToFloat
Action.Description: Converts the value to a float. In this case, for a string, the contents of the string are parsed and converted rather than the string type itself. Invalid values will cause an exception to be thrown.
Action.Summary: Converts the value to a float. In this case, for a string, the contents of the string are parsed and converted rather than the string type itself. Invalid values will cause an exception to be thrown.

Action.name: valueToFloatSafe
Action.Description: Converts the value to a float. In this case, for a string, the contents of the string are parsed and converted rather than the string type itself. Invalid values will result in float.NaN.
Action.Summary: Converts the value to a float. In this case, for a string, the contents of the string are parsed and converted rather than the string type itself. Invalid values will result in float.NaN.

Action.name: valueToString
Action.Description: Converts the value of an any to a string. This mimics the any.valueToString() with the exception that an empty any results in an empty string rather than "empty".

Type.name: MinHeap
Type.Description:
Heap of float values which allows to query and extract minimum value.
It is a complete binary tree which is stored in an array. The root node is at index 1. All other values are stored from index 1 onwards such that children of a node at index n are stored at index 2 * n and 2 * n + 1. Parent of a node n can be found at index floor (n / 2).
All nodes in this tree maintains min-heap property: each node must be less than its descendants. This property is maintained for every push and pop operation.
See https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Binary_heap for details.
Type.Summary: Heap of float values which allows to query and extract minimum value.

Action.Summary: Check if heap is empty.

Action.Description: Check if the value at first index is greater than the value at second index.
Action.Summary: Check if the value at first index is greater than the value at second index.

Parameter.name: first
Parameter.Description: The first index.

Parameter.name: second
Parameter.Description: The second index.

Action.Description: Check the minimum value present in the heap without removing it. Must not be called on empty heap.
Action.Summary: Check the minimum value present in the heap without removing it. Must not be called on empty heap.

Returns.Description: The minimum value in the heap.

Action.name: pop
Action.Description: Return the minimum value in the heap and return it. Must not be called on empty heap.
Action.Summary: Return the minimum value in the heap and return it. Must not be called on empty heap.

Returns.Description: The minimum value in the heap.

Action.Summary: Sink the value at given index until it is less than its parent.

Parameter.name: k

Action.Description: Swap the values at two given index.
Action.Summary: Swap the values at two given index.

Parameter.name: i

Type.name: TimersManager
Type.Description:
Manage pending timers for a chain or a block.
Instance of the <tt>TimersManager</tt> should be created via <tt>TimersManager.create</tt> action which takes an callback action. The callback action is called when a timer is triggered, model/chain should be evaluated when it is called. Once the evaluation is completed for the time, the <tt>resume()</tt> action of the <tt>TimersManager</tt> should be called.
It uses MinHeap data structure to maintain current set of pending timers and schedule the minimum timers from the heap by creating a wait listener. It maintains at max one active wait listener at a time.
If a schedule timer request is received for a time which is less than the currently scheduled time, it cancels the active listener and create new wait listener for the new time.
Once a timer is triggered, the TimerManager goes into the paused state and accumulates timers without processing them. Timer processing is only resumed when <tt>resume()</tt> action is called. This is done to make sure that all timer requests are accumulated during a model or chain execution before picking of the next minimum timer time.
It also supports setting up a maxEvalTime - timers are executed as long as ther are less than or equal to the maxEvalTime. Timers greater than the maxEvalTime are accumulated and only processed when maxEvalTime is cleared.
Type.Summary: Manage pending timers for a chain or a block.

Member.name: id
Member.Description: The chain or block id.
Member.Summary: The chain or block id.

Member.name: lastEvalTime
Member.Description: Last time we evaluated. Timers equal to or older than this time are rejected because we cannot evaluate a model/chain twice for a same time or evauluate backward in time.
Member.Summary: Last time we evaluated. Timers equal to or older than this time are rejected because we cannot evaluate a model/chain twice for a same time or evauluate backward in time.

Member.name: pendingAbsoluteTimers
Member.Description: All pending absolute timers, keyed against triggerTimer.
Member.Summary: All pending absolute timers, keyed against triggerTimer.

Member.name: pendingRelativeTimers
Member.Description: All pending relative timers, keyed against triggerTime, used for lookup for a timestamp. Save model and relativeTimerId as well so that if model is in chain then relativeTimerId should be sent only to that model.
Member.Summary: All pending relative timers, keyed against triggerTime, used for lookup for a timestamp. Save model and relativeTimerId as well so that if model is in chain then relativeTimerId should be sent only to that model.

Member.name: relativeTimers
Member.Description: Relative timers mapped from Timer_ModelInfo to timestamp. Mainly used for cancelling relative timers. If in chain, relativerTimerId might not be unique, so dictionary must be keyed against modelId.
Member.Summary: Relative timers mapped from Timer_ModelInfo to timestamp. Mainly used for cancelling relative timers. If in chain, relativerTimerId might not be unique, so dictionary must be keyed against modelId.

Member.Summary: Currently active wait listener.

Member.Summary: Is the chain is currently being executed. We should not schedule next timer yet - wait for all timer requests generated during the evaluation of the chain.
